subject: Economics
title: Microfinance: Small Loans, Big Hopes, Mixed Results
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Microfinance: Small Loans, Big Hopes, Mixed Results.

hook.text: Muhammad Yunus lent $27 to 42 women in Bangladesh and launched a global movement.

buildup.text: Microfinance: tiny loans to the poorest who lack bank access.

discovery.text: Yunus's Grameen Bank served 9 million borrowers with 97% repayment rates. The model spread to 100+ countries.

twist.text: Rigorous studies found microfinance doesn't significantly increase income or business growth.

climax.text: Microfinance isn't a silver bullet â€” but it provides real value as financial inclusion.

punchline.text: Small loans don't end poverty. But they do end financial exclusion.

quiz.question: What did rigorous research reveal about microfinance's impact on poverty?
options: Microfinance helps smooth consumption and provides financial inclusion but doesn't significantly increase income or lift people out of poverty
